text: Which article of the Philippine Constitution declares that the Philippines is a democratic and republican state?
explanation: Article II, Section 1 of the 1987 Philippine Constitution states: 'The Philippines is a democratic and republican State.'

text: Ano ang sinasabi ng Saligang Batas tungkol sa pagiging sakop ng batas?

options.text: Ang Pangulo lamang ang sakop ng batas
Ang mga ordinaryong mamamayan lamang ang sakop ng batas
Walang sinuman ang sakop ng batas
Walang sinuman ang nakaaangat sa batas

explanation: Ipinahahayag ng Saligang Batas ang prinsipyo ng 'Rule of Law' kung saan walang sinuman, maging pangulo o ordinaryong mamamayan, ang nakaaangat sa batas.

text: The constitutional guarantee that 'No person shall be deprived of life, liberty, or property without due process of law' is found in which section of the Bill of Rights?
explanation: This fundamental guarantee, which applies to all persons, is explicitly stated in Article III (Bill of Rights), Section 1 of the 1987 Philippine Constitution.

text: Ayon sa Saligang Batas, ilang taon ang termino ng isang regular na miyembro ng Kapulungan ng mga Kinatawan (House of Representatives)?

options.text: Tatlong (3) taon at maaaring mahalal muli
Apat (4) na taon at maaaring mahalal muli
Anim (6) na taon at maaaring mahalal muli
Anim (6) na taon at hindi na maaaring mahalal muli

explanation: Ang mga Kinatawan ay nagsisilbi sa loob ng tatlong (3) taon at maaaring mahalal muli, ngunit hindi hihigit sa tatlong magkakasunod na termino (Article VI, Sec. 7).

text: What is the term of office for the President of the Philippines, as stipulated by the 1987 Constitution?

options.text: Four years, with one re-election allowed
Six years, with one re-election allowed

explanation: The President shall have a term of six years, which shall begin at noon on the thirtieth day of June next following the election, and shall not be eligible for any reelection (Article VII, Sec. 4).

text: Ang ___________ ay ang doktrina na nagsasaad na ang mga probinsya, lungsod, at munisipalidad ay nagtatamasa ng kapangyarihan na pamahalaan ang kanilang sarili.
explanation: Ang Local Autonomy (Lokal na Awtonomiya) ay ang kapangyarihan ng mga local government units (LGUs) na pamahalaan ang kanilang sarili, na itinataguyod ng Article X ng Saligang Batas.

text: Which Article of the Constitution establishes the Commission on Audit (COA), Civil Service Commission (CSC), and Commission on Elections (COMELEC) as independent constitutional commissions?
explanation: Article IX of the 1987 Constitution is dedicated entirely to the three independent Constitutional Commissions: the CSC, COMELEC, and COA.

text: The legislative power of the Philippine Government is vested in the:
explanation: Article VI, Section 1 of the Constitution vests the legislative power in the Congress of the Philippines, which consists of the Senate and the House of Representatives. This embodies the principle of separation of powers.

text: Aling ahensya ng gobyerno ang may eksklusibong kapangyarihan na magpasiya ng lahat ng 'contests' o hindi pagkakasundo ukol sa halalan, returns, at qualifications ng Pangulo at Pangalawang Pangulo?
explanation: Ayon sa Article VII, Section 4, ang Supreme Court, sa buong sesyon, ang magsisilbing Presidential Electoral Tribunal (PET) at ito ang magiging tanging 'judge' ng lahat ng 'contests' ukol sa halalan ng Pangulo at Pangalawang Pangulo.

text: The primary role of the Supreme Court, as defined in Article VIII of the Constitution, is the exercise of:
explanation: The Constitution vests judicial power in the Supreme Court and such lower courts as may be established by law (Article VIII, Section 1).

text: What is the constitutional provision that allows the Congress, by a vote of two-thirds of both Houses voting separately, to propose amendments to the Constitution?
explanation: Article XVII (Amendments or Revisions) provides the methods by which the Constitution can be changed, including the proposal of amendments by Congress (Section 1).

text: Ang Social Justice o Katarungang Panlipunan ay ipinapahayag ng Saligang Batas bilang:

options.text: Ang pagsasagawa ng karapatan sa pribadong ari-arian
Ang pangako ng pamahalaan na bawasan ang hindi pagkakapantay-pantay
Ang pagkakapantay-pantay sa harap ng batas lamang
Ang pagpapahalaga sa indibidwal na kalayaan higit sa lahat

explanation: Ang Social Justice ay ang pangako ng Estado na itaguyod ang kagalingan ng lahat ng tao at bawasan ang hindi pagkakapantay-pantay (Article II, Section 10).

text: The power of the State to take private property for public use upon payment of just compensation is called:
explanation: Eminent Domain is an inherent power of the State, constrained by the Bill of Rights (Article III, Section 9) which requires just compensation and public use.

text: Ilang taon ang itinalagang termino para sa mga Senador ng Pilipinas ayon sa 1987 Constitution?
explanation: Ang termino ng isang Senador ay anim (6) na taon, at maaari lamang siyang mahalal nang hindi hihigit sa dalawang magkakasunod na termino (Article VI, Sec. 4).

text: What is the primary check of the Judicial Department (Supreme Court) on the powers of the Legislative and Executive Departments?
explanation: Judicial Review is the power of the courts to determine whether laws or executive acts are consistent with the Constitution (Article VIII, Sec. 1).

text: The State policy recognizing the vital role of the youth in nation-building and promoting their physical, moral, intellectual, and social well-being is found in which article?

options.text: Article II (Declaration of Principles and State Policies)

explanation: Article II, Section 13 states: 'The State recognizes the vital role of the youth in nation-building and shall promote and protect their physical, moral, intellectual, and social well-being.'

text: Ang kapangyarihan ng Pangulo na tanggihan ang isang panukalang batas na ipinasa ng Kongreso ay tinatawag na:
explanation: Ang Veto Power ang kapangyarihan ng Pangulo na opisyal na tumanggi sa isang batas. Ito ay bahagi ng sistema ng Checks and Balances.

text: The power of the State to enact laws that promote the general welfare, health, safety, and morals of the people is known as:
explanation: Police Power is the most pervasive, least limitable, and most demanding of the three inherent powers of the State, focused on promoting the general welfare and public interest.

text: Under Article V (Suffrage), the Congress is mandated to provide a system for absentee voting for qualified Filipinos. This type of voting covers:

options.text: Only members of the Armed Forces and Police.
Qualified Filipinos abroad and those locally displaced.

explanation: Article V, Section 2 requires Congress to provide for a system for absentee voting by qualified Filipinos abroad. Local absentee voting is an expansion provided by statute, but the constitutional mandate primarily focuses on those abroad.

text: The 1987 Constitution was ratified by the Filipino people on:
explanation: The 1987 Constitution was ratified by a nationwide plebiscite on February 2, 1987.

text: Ang kapangyarihang maglunsad ng 'Impeachment' laban sa Pangulo, Bise-Presidente, at iba pang opisyal ay eksklusibong nasa:
explanation: Ayon sa Article XI, Section 3(1), ang House of Representatives ang may eksklusibong kapangyarihang magpasimula ng lahat ng kaso ng impeachment.

text: What is the minimum age requirement for a person to be elected as a Senator in the Philippines?
explanation: Article VI, Section 3 requires a Senator to be at least thirty-five years of age on the day of the election, a natural-born citizen, able to read and write, and a registered voter.

text: The principle of 'Sovereignty of the People' is expressed in the Constitution through the exercise of:

options.text: The power of the President to declare martial law.
The right to suffrage (voting) and the power of initiative and referendum.

options.d: The separation of powers among the three branches.

options.text: The power of the Supreme Court to interpret laws.

explanation: The Constitution states that 'Sovereignty resides in the people and all government authority emanates from them' (Article II, Sec. 1). This sovereignty is directly exercised through the ballot box and mechanisms like initiative and referendum.

text: What does the Archipelagic Principle in the Philippine Constitution assert?

options.text: That the government must promote local autonomy.
That the judicial power includes the duty to settle actual controversies.
That the territory of the Philippines is composed of its islands and the waters connecting them.
That the State shall pursue an independent foreign policy.

explanation: The Archipelagic Principle (Article I, National Territory) treats the islands and the waters within the archipelagic baselines as one integral unit, ensuring the territorial integrity of the country.

text: Ang Official Language ng Pilipinas at ang wikang pantulong sa komunikasyon at pagtuturo ayon sa Saligang Batas ay:

options.text: Filipino, at, hangga't walang ibang itinatadhana ang batas, English

explanation: Ayon sa Article XIV, Section 6 at 7, ang wikang pambansa ay Filipino. Para sa mga opisyal na layunin, ang mga opisyal na wika ay Filipino, at, hangga't walang ibang itinatadhana ang batas, English.

text: The Constitutional provision regarding the Non-Establishment Clause ensures the separation of:
explanation: Article III, Section 5 states: 'No law shall be made respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof...' This enshrines the separation of Church and State.

text: What is the specific requirement under the Bill of Rights (Article III) for the issuance of a Search Warrant or Warrant of Arrest?

options.text: It must be issued by a member of the Philippine National Police.
It must be issued upon probable cause to be determined personally by the judge.

options.d: It must be issued by a prosecutor after preliminary investigation.

options.text: It must be approved by the Department of Justice Secretary.

explanation: Article III, Section 2 states that no search warrant or warrant of arrest shall issue except upon probable cause to be determined personally by the judge after examination under oath or affirmation of the complainant and the witnesses he may produce.

text: Ilang beses maaaring mahalal muli ang isang miyembro ng Senado sa magkakasunod na termino?
explanation: Ang Senador ay may 6 na taong termino at 'shall not serve for more than two consecutive terms' (Article VI, Sec. 4). Dahil isang beses na siyang nahalal, maaari pa siyang mahalal ng 'isa' pang beses upang makumpleto ang dalawang magkakasunod na termino.

text: The mandate of the Office of the Ombudsman is primarily found under which Article?
explanation: Article XI addresses the accountability of public officers and specifically creates the independent Office of the Ombudsman, which investigates complaints against public officials.

text: The constitutional provision guaranteeing the right of the people to information on matters of public concern is a cornerstone of:
explanation: Article III, Section 7 recognizes the right to information, which is essential for ensuring that the government remains transparent and accountable to the people.

text: Aling Principle of State Policies ang nagsasabing ang Estado ay nagpapahalaga sa dignidad ng bawat tao at ginagarantiyahan ang lubos na paggalang sa mga karapatang pantao?

options.text: Respect for Human Dignity and Human Rights

explanation: Article II, Section 11, ay tahasang nagpapahayag na: 'The State values the dignity of every human person and guarantees full respect for human rights.'

text: Which condition is NOT a required qualification for a member of the House of Representatives?

options.text: At least twenty-five years of age
A registered voter in the district in which he shall be elected

options.d: A resident thereof for a period of not less than two years immediately preceding the election

options.text: A natural-born citizen of the Philippines

explanation: Article VI, Section 6 requires residency for not less than one year, not two years, immediately preceding the election. The other options are correct qualifications.

text: The provision that the military shall be the protector of the people and the State is found in which article?

options.c: Article II (Declaration of Principles and State Policies)

explanation: Article II, Section 3 states: 'The Armed Forces of the Philippines is the protector of the people and the State. Its goal is to secure the sovereignty of the State and the integrity of the national territory.'

text: Ang kapangyarihan ng Pangulo na 'Suspend the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus' ay maaari lamang gamitin sa kaso ng:
explanation: Article VII, Section 18, ay nagpapahintulot sa Pangulo na isuspinde ang pribilehiyo ng writ of habeas corpus, o ideklara ang batas militar (Martial Law), sa kaso lamang ng pagsalakay o paghihimagsik, kapag kinakailangan ng kaligtasan ng publiko.

text: The constitutional body responsible for enforcing and administering all laws and regulations relative to the conduct of elections is the:
explanation: The COMELEC is the independent constitutional commission primarily vested with the exclusive power to administer and enforce election laws (Article IX-C).

text: Which check does the Senate exercise over the Executive Department, specifically concerning the President's appointments?

options.text: Power of the Commission on Appointments (CA)

explanation: The Commission on Appointments (CA), composed of members of both the Senate and the House of Representatives (with the Senate President as ex officio chairman), confirms certain appointments made by the President. The Senate, as a chamber, also has the exclusive power to ratify treaties (Option c), which is also a check on the Executive, but the CA power is the direct check on appointments.

text: Ang principle of checks and balances ay nilalayon na:

options.text: Pigilan ang labis na kapangyarihan ng isang sangay ng gobyerno
Gawin ang Kongreso na mas makapangyarihan kaysa iba

explanation: Ang checks and balances ay isang mekanismo upang matiyak na walang solong sangay (Executive, Legislative, o Judicial) ang magiging masyadong makapangyarihan sa pamamagitan ng pagpapahintulot sa bawat isa na limitahan ang iba.

text: What form of government does the Philippines adopt?
explanation: According to Article II, Section 1 of the 1987 Constitution, 'The Philippines is a **democratic** and **republican** State.'

text: Who among the following may issue a warrant of arrest or a search warrant?
explanation: According to the Constitution, no warrant of arrest or search warrant shall issue except upon **probable cause** to be determined personally by the **judge** after examination under oath or affirmation of the complainant and the witnesses he may produce.

text: A foreigner may acquire Filipino citizenship through
explanation: Naturalization is the legal process by which a foreigner acquires the citizenship of another country, in this case, the Philippines.

text: What is regarded by the State as a 'primary social economic force?'
explanation: Article II, Section 18 of the 1987 Constitution states: 'The State affirms **labor** as a **primary social economic force**. It shall protect the rights of workers and promote their welfare.'

text: According to Article III, Section 15 of the Constitution, the writ of habeas corpus may be suspended in times of rebellion or what?
explanation: Article III, Section 15 states that the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus shall not be suspended except in cases of **invasion** or rebellion when the public safety requires it.

text: The Lower Chamber of the Congress of the Philippines is known by what name?
explanation: The Philippine Congress is bicameral, composed of the Upper House (Senate) and the Lower House, known as the **House of Representatives**.

text: A Member of either house of Congress may be expelled by their fellow Members. For a Member to be expelled, how much of the total number of Members of a house must concur with the expulsion?
explanation: Article VI, Section 16 (3) states that each House may punish its Members for disorderly behavior, and, with the concurrence of **two-thirds** of all its Members, suspend or expel a Member.

text: If a President wishes to veto a bill, he/she must communicate it within a certain span of time, otherwise the bill will become a law. How long is this span of time?
explanation: The President must veto the bill and return it to the House where it originated within **30 days** after receiving it. If the President fails to act on the bill within that period, it shall become a law as if he/she had signed it (Article VI, Section 27).

text: Which is not a ground for Impeachment of the President, Vice-President, Ombudsman, and Senator?

options.text: against the Family if the child scolded by the parents

explanation: The constitutional grounds for impeachment are: culpable violation of the Constitution, treason, bribery, **graft and corruption**, **other high crimes**, or **grave abuse of power**. While sexual harassment (b) and other crimes (e) could potentially fall under 'other high crimes,' scolding a child (**d**) is a domestic matter and not an official crime or action serious enough to be a ground for impeachment against a high-ranking official.
